structure.unit: A CABINET FOR HEALTH AND FAMILY SERVICES

law.catch_line: Delivery of health services by staff -- Abuse, neglect, and exploitation of clients, policies and reporting.

text.section: The department shall report to the Division of Health Care any alleged or actual cases of health services being delivered by the staff of an assisted-living community.

An assisted-living community shall have written policies on reporting and recordkeeping of alleged or actual cases of abuse, neglect, or exploitation of an adult under KRS 209.030. The only requisite components of a recordkeeping policy are the date and time of the report, the reporting method, and a brief summary of the alleged incident.

Any assisted-living community staff member who has reasonable cause to suspect that a client has suffered abuse, neglect, or exploitation shall report the abuse, neglect, or exploitation under KRS 209.030.
